page.title: 04TRADE IN CHIRNSIDE
page.content: There are now only 23 shops, garages and hotels in Chirnside compared with the 60 shops there used to be in the 1930s.This is because nowadays most people go to larger towns, eg Berwick, for cheaper shopping. There is only one post office/shop and one hotel in nearby Allanton. There used to be 21 shops. In Chirnside there are 4 garages, an agricultural supplier, 2 hotels, one public house, 2 butchers' shops, a post office, a bank, a fitted furniture centre, a wool and hardware shop, a chip shop, 2 grocers, a newsagent, a shoe shop, a hairdresser, a draper, a soft furnishings shop and a baker's shop/cafe. There are one plumbing, 4 building and 2 joinery businesses as well as 2 log merchants and a sawmill in Chirnside, and a joinery business in Allanton.
